cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ENE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast along the Mid-Atlantic coast and expected to move inland across the Northeast toward southern New England and Maine
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central New Jersey coast

weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape May, New Jersey to Watch Hill, Rhode Island, including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Delaware and New Jersey coasts northward through Long Island, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Massachusetts and coastal Maine
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to near 35 mph possible Saturday afternoon-night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding/rip current risk possible along Boston Harbor but significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain possible Saturday into early Sunday with localized flash-flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions for approaching and departing vessels
